Multimodal Transformers
  • multimodal_transformers.data
  • View page source

multimodal_transformers.data

The data module includes two functions to help load your own datasets into multimodal_transformers.data.tabular_torch_dataset.TorchTabularTextDataset which can be fed into a torch.utils.data.DataLoader. The multimodal_transformers.data.tabular_torch_dataset.TorchTabularTextDataset’s __getitem__ method’s outputs can be directly fed to the forward pass to a model in multimodal_transformers.model.tabular_transformers.

Note

You may still need to move the __getitem__ method outputs to the right gpu device.

Module contents

class TorchTabularTextDataset(encodings, categorical_feats, numerical_feats, labels=None, df=None, label_list=None)[source]

Bases: Dataset

TorchDataset wrapper for text dataset with categorical features and numerical features

Parameters:

  • encodings (BatchEncoding) – The output from encode_plus() and batch_encode() methods (tokens, attention_masks, etc.) of a transformers.PreTrainedTokenizer.

  • categorical_feats (Optional[DataFrame]) – An array containing the preprocessed categorical features. Shape: (n_examples, categorical feat dim).

  • numerical_feats (Optional[DataFrame]) – An array containing the preprocessed numerical features. Shape: (n_examples, numerical feat dim).

  • labels (Union[List, ndarray, None]) – The labels of the training examples.

  • df (Optional[DataFrame]) – The original dataset. Optional and used only to save the original dataset with the preprocessed dataset.

  • label_list (Optional[List[str]]) – A list of class names for each unique class in labels.

get_labels()[source]

Returns the label names for classification.

Return type:

Optional[List[str]]

load_data(data_df, text_cols, tokenizer, label_col=None, label_list=[], categorical_cols=[], numerical_cols=[], sep_text_token_str=' ', categorical_transformer=None, numerical_transformer=None, empty_text_values=None, replace_empty_text=None, max_token_length=None, debug=False, debug_dataset_size=100)[source]

Load a single dataset from a pandas DataFrame.

Given a DataFrame, this function loads the data into a torch_dataset.TorchTextDataset object, which can be used in a torch.utils.data.DataLoader.

Parameters:

  • data_df (DataFrame) – The DataFrame to convert to a TorchTextDataset.

  • text_cols (List[str]) – The column names in the dataset that contain text data.

  • tokenizer (PreTrainedTokenizer) – HuggingFace tokenizer used for tokenizing text columns specified in text_cols.

  • label_col (Optional[str]) – The column name containing the target labels. For classification, the values should be integers representing class indices. For regression, they can be any numeric values.

  • label_list (Optional[List[str]]) – List of class names for classification tasks, corresponding to the values in label_col.

  • categorical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing categorical features. These features can either be preprocessed numerically or processed according to the specified transformer.

  • numerical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing numerical features, which should contain only numeric values.

  • sep_text_token_str (str) – String used to separate different text columns for a single data sample. For example, for BERT models, this could be the [SEP] token.

  • categorical_transformer (Optional[CategoricalFeatures]) – Sklearn transformer instance for preprocessing categorical features.

  • numerical_transformer (Optional[NumericalFeatures]) – Sklearn transformer instance for preprocessing numerical features.

  • empty_text_values (Optional[List[str]]) – List of text values that should be treated as missing.

  • replace_empty_text (Optional[str]) – Value to replace empty text values (specified by empty_text_values). If None, empty text values are ignored.

  • max_token_length (Optional[int]) – Maximum token length to pad or truncate the input text to.

  • debug (bool) – Whether to load a smaller debug version of the dataset.

  • debug_dataset_size (int) – The size of the dataset to load when debug is set to True.

Return type:

TorchTabularTextDataset

load_data_from_folder(folder_path, text_cols, tokenizer, label_col, label_list=[], categorical_cols=[], numerical_cols=[], sep_text_token_str=' ', categorical_encode_type='ohe', categorical_handle_na=False, categorical_na_value='-9999999', ohe_handle_unknown='error', numerical_transformer_method='quantile_normal', numerical_handle_na=False, numerical_how_handle_na='value', numerical_na_value=0.0, empty_text_values=None, replace_empty_text=None, max_token_length=None, debug=False, debug_dataset_size=100, output_dir=None)[source]

Load tabular and text data from a specified folder.

This function loads training, testing, and optionally validation data from a folder into the TorchTextDataset class, performing preprocessing on categorical and numerical data as specified. The folder should contain train.csv, test.csv, and optionally val.csv files.

Returns a tuple containing the training, validation, and testing datasets. The validation dataset is None if no val.csv is found in folder_path.

Parameters:

  • folder_path (str) – Path to the folder containing the train.csv, test.csv, and optionally val.csv files.

  • text_cols (List[str]) – List of column names in the dataset that contain text data.

  • tokenizer (PreTrainedTokenizer) – HuggingFace tokenizer used for tokenizing text columns specified in text_cols.

  • label_col (str) – Column name containing the target labels. For classification, the values should be integers representing class indices. For regression, they can be any numeric values.

  • label_list (Optional[List[str]]) – List of class names for classification tasks, corresponding to the values in label_col.

  • categorical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing categorical features. These features can either be preprocessed numerically or processed according to the categorical_encode_type.

  • numerical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing numerical features, which should contain only numeric values.

  • sep_text_token_str (str) – String used to separate different text columns for a single data sample. For example, for BERT models, this could be the [SEP] token.

  • categorical_encode_type (str) – Method for encoding categorical features. Options are: - ‘ohe’: One-hot encoding - ‘binary’: Binary encoding - None: No encoding

  • categorical_handle_na (bool) – Whether to handle missing values in categorical features.

  • categorical_na_value (str) – Value used to replace missing categorical values, if categorical_handle_na is set to True.

  • ohe_handle_unknown (str) – Strategy for handling unknown categories in one-hot encoding. Options are: - ‘error’: Raise an error for unknown categories - ‘ignore’: Ignore unknown categories during encoding

  • numerical_transformer_method (str) – Method for normalizing numerical features. Options are: - ‘yeo_johnson’ - ‘box_cox’ - ‘quantile_normal’ - None: No transformation

  • numerical_handle_na (bool) – Whether to handle missing values in numerical features.

  • numerical_how_handle_na (str) – Method for handling missing numerical values. Options are: - ‘value’: Replace with a specific value. - ‘mean’: Replace with the mean of the column.

  • numerical_na_value (float) – Value used to replace missing numerical values, if numerical_handle_na is set to True.

  • empty_text_values (Optional[List[str]]) – List of text values that should be treated as missing.

  • replace_empty_text (Optional[str]) – Value to replace empty text values (specified by empty_text_values). If None, empty text values are ignored.

  • max_token_length (Optional[int]) – Maximum token length to pad or truncate the input text to.

  • debug (bool) – Whether to load a smaller debug version of the dataset.

  • debug_dataset_size (int) – The size of the dataset to load when debug is set to True.

  • output_dir (Optional[str]) – Directory to save the processed dataset files.

Return type:

Tuple[TorchTabularTextDataset, Optional[TorchTabularTextDataset], TorchTabularTextDataset]

load_data_into_folds(data_csv_path, num_splits, validation_ratio, text_cols, tokenizer, label_col, label_list=[], categorical_cols=[], numerical_cols=[], sep_text_token_str=' ', categorical_encode_type='ohe', categorical_handle_na=False, categorical_na_value='-9999999', ohe_handle_unknown='error', numerical_transformer_method='quantile_normal', numerical_handle_na=False, numerical_how_handle_na='value', numerical_na_value=0.0, empty_text_values=None, replace_empty_text=None, max_token_length=None, debug=False, debug_dataset_size=100, output_dir=None)[source]

Load tabular and text data from a specified folder into folds.

This function loads training, testing, and optionally validation data from a CSV file into the specified number of cross-validation folds. The function performs categorical and numerical preprocessing as specified.

Returns a tuple containing three lists representing the splits of training, validation, and testing sets. The length of the lists is equal to the number of folds specified by num_splits.

Parameters:

  • data_csv_path (str) – The path to the CSV containing the data.

  • num_splits (int) – The number of cross-validation folds to split the data into.

  • validation_ratio (float) – A float between 0 and 1 representing the percentage of the data to hold as a consistent validation set.

  • text_cols (List[str]) – The column names in the dataset that contain text data.

  • tokenizer (PreTrainedTokenizer) – HuggingFace tokenizer used for tokenizing text columns specified in text_cols.

  • label_col (str) – Column name containing the target labels. For classification, the values should be integers representing class indices. For regression, they can be any numeric values.

  • label_list (Optional[List[str]]) – List of class names for classification tasks, corresponding to the values in label_col.

  • categorical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing categorical features. These features can either be preprocessed numerically or processed according to the categorical_encode_type.

  • numerical_cols (Optional[List[str]]) – List of column names containing numerical features, which should contain only numeric values.

  • sep_text_token_str (str) – String used to separate different text columns for a single data sample. For example, for BERT models, this could be the [SEP] token.

  • categorical_encode_type (str) – Method for encoding categorical features. Options are: - ‘ohe’: One-hot encoding - ‘binary’: Binary encoding - None: No encoding

  • categorical_handle_na (bool) – Whether to handle missing values in categorical features.

  • categorical_na_value (str) – Value used to replace missing categorical values, if categorical_handle_na is set to True.

  • ohe_handle_unknown (str) – Strategy for handling unknown categories in one-hot encoding. Options are: - ‘error’: Raise an error for unknown categories - ‘ignore’: Ignore unknown categories during encoding

  • numerical_transformer_method (str) – Method for normalizing numerical features. Options are: - ‘yeo_johnson’ - ‘box_cox’ - ‘quantile_normal’ - None: No transformation

  • numerical_handle_na (bool) – Whether to handle missing values in numerical features.

  • numerical_how_handle_na (str) – Method for handling missing numerical values. Options are: - ‘value’: Replace with a specific value. - ‘mean’: Replace with the mean of the column.

  • numerical_na_value (float) – Value used to replace missing numerical values, if numerical_handle_na is set to True.

  • empty_text_values (Optional[List[str]]) – List of text values that should be treated as missing.

  • replace_empty_text (Optional[str]) – Value to replace empty text values (specified by empty_text_values). If None, empty text values are ignored.

  • max_token_length (Optional[int]) – Maximum token length to pad or truncate the input text to.

  • debug (bool) – Whether to load a smaller debug version of the dataset.

  • debug_dataset_size (int) – The size of the dataset to load when debug is set to True.

  • output_dir (Optional[str]) – Directory to save the processed dataset files.

Return type:

Tuple[List[TorchTabularTextDataset], List[Optional[TorchTabularTextDataset]], List[TorchTabularTextDataset]]
